intro: Pterygodium ingeanum, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, fleshy fruits. Its roots and stems contain alkaloids, which have been traditionally used in herbal medicine. The botanical features of Pterygodium ingeanum make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological contexts.
